children.value:
Modul 117: Informatik- und Netzinfrastruktur fr ein kleines Unternehmen realisieren
In diesem Modul planst, installierst und testest du ein kleines Netzwerk mit Computern und Druckern. Dabei erstellst du auch Plne und richtest Datei- und Druckfreigaben ein.

Modul 122: Ablufe mit einer Scriptsprache automatisieren
Du automatisierst Ablufe mit Scripts, z.B. fr die Systemverwaltung. Dazu planst du den Ablauf, schreibst das Script, testest es und dokumentierst den Einsatz.

Modul 162: Daten analysieren und modellieren
Du untersuchst Daten, prfst ihre Qualitt und erstellst daraus ein Datenmodell. Dieses Modell wandelst du dann in ein logisches, relationales Modell um und stellst es bersichtlich dar.

Modul 106: Datenbanken abfragen, bearbeiten und warten
Du lernst, Daten gezielt abzufragen, zu bearbeiten und die Datenbank schneller zu machen. Auerdem sicherst du Daten, stellst sie wieder her und schtzt sie durch Benutzerrechte.

Modul 231: Datenschutz und Datensicherheit anwenden
Du schtzt Daten durch passende Sicherheits- und Datenschutzmassnahmen und prfst, ob Systeme die Regeln einhalten. Dabei lernst du auch die wichtigsten Gesetze und Software-Lsungen kennen.

Modul 293: Webauftritt erstellen und verffentlichen
Du planst, entwickelst und verffentlichst eine einfache Webseite nach Vorgaben. Dabei arbeitest du mit modernen Webtechnologien und berprfst die Funktion und Gestaltung.

Modul 319: Applikationen entwerfen und implementieren
Du lernst, Probleme zu erkennen, Lsungen zu planen und einfache Programme zu schreiben. Dabei setzt du Programmiergrundlagen, Kontrollstrukturen und Funktionen ein und achtest auf sauberen, gut dokumentierten Code.

Modul 431: Auftrge im eigenen Berufsumfeld selbststndig durchfhren
In diesem Modul lernst du, berufliche Auftrge selbststndig zu planen, umzusetzen und zu dokumentieren. Du nutzt passende Methoden und prsentierst das Ergebnis dem Auftraggeber.

Modul 106: Datenbanken abfragen, bearbeiten und warten
Du lernst, Daten gezielt abzufragen, zu bearbeiten und die Datenbank schneller zu machen. Auerdem sicherst du Daten, stellst sie bei Bedarf wieder her und setzt Rechte fr den Datenschutz.

Modul 187: ICT-Arbeitsplatz mit Betriebssystem in Betrieb nehmen
Du lernst, einen Computer-Arbeitsplatz mit Betriebssystem, Programmen und Netzwerk sicher einzurichten. Dabei prfst die Hardware, installierst alles nach Vorgabe, behebst Fehler und richtest den Arbeitsplatz ergonomisch ein.

Modul 216: Internet of Everything-Endgerte in bestehende Plattform integrieren
Du whlst passende IoE-Gerte (z.B. smarte Sensoren) aus, richtest sie sicher ein und bindest sie ins Netzwerk ein. Danach testest du die Gerte und dokumentierst die Lsung.

Modul 114: Codierungs-, Kompressions- und Verschlsselungsverfahren einsetzen
In diesem Modul lernst du, Daten richtig zu codieren, komprimieren und verschlsseln. Du wendest sichere bertragungsverfahren an, erkennst Schwachstellen und vergleichst verschiedene Technologien.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Auto typing animation for text ("typewriter" effect)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AutoTyping
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Reveal a text one letter after the other.
description: Reveal a text one letter after the other (a "typewriter" effect).
It can be used for dialogue scenes or visual novels on Text and Bitmap Text objects.
The top-down RPG example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

changelog.breaking: - Buttons now use "variants", allowing easy swapping of their visual aspect. You will have to make some adjustments to existing buttons in your project. Follow this [migration documentation](https://wiki.gdevelop.io/gdevelop5/objects/custom-objects-prefab-template/migrate-to-variants/) to do these changes.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AdvancedJump
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Sports and Fitness/Sports and Fitness_training_running_run.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Let platformer characters: air jump, wall jump wall sliding, coyote time and dashing.
description: This extension provides behaviors to:
* Jump in mid-air
* Jump and slide against walls
* Dash horizontally
* Dash toward the floor

* Do coyote time, also known as "ledge tolerance". It lets players jumping even after their character is no longer touching the ground for a given amount of time. It aims to give players a feeling of control and reduce frustration.
An example allows to check it out ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer-moves)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Let platformer characters jump shortly after leaving a platform and also jump in mid-air.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: AdvancedJump

events.comment: Avoid any side effect if the feature is not used.
The timeframe is starting.
The timeframe is missed.
Coyote jump
The new value will be used next frame.
While in the coyote jump frame, the Object is treated as being on the floor. No air jump can happen.
When the object fall, it doesn't jump but air jumps must be allowed

The order of these events is important because the idle state is:
on the floor and jump key released but the 1st jump must not count.
Reset air jump counter.
Allow air jumps.
Coyote time was disabled, so WasInTheAir may not have been updated for a long time.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AdvancedProjectile
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Control how a projectile moves including speed, acceleration, distance, and lifetime.
description: Control how a projectile moves including speed, acceleration, distance, and lifetime.
Tips:
- To simulate a rocket, use a starting speed of 0 and a positive acceleration (max speed may also be used)
- To simulate a hand grenade, use a high starting speed, a negative acceleration, and a non-zero lifetime
- If the object is not moving, acceleration will be towards the direction it is facing
- If the object is moving, acceleration will be in the direction the object is moving

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FireBullet
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading and overheating.
description: This extension allows objects to fire bullets. To use it, add the behavior to the object that will shoot, then use the provided action to launch another object as the bullet.
The properties of the behavior can be used to customize:
- Cooldown between shots
- Firing multiple bullets at a time ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://fire-bullet))
- Ammo management
- Overheat
It can be used for:
- Twin-stick shooters ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://conviction-of-gun-dude-desktop))
- Shoot'em up ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://space-shooter))
A simple example shows how to make firing patterns ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://firing-patterns)).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: EllipseMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects on ellipses or smoothly back and forth in one direction.
description: It allows objects to move:
- on an ellipsis or arcs
- smoothly vertically or horizontally (by setting one radius to 0)
- on a sine wave (by adding a force)
Instances will start their movement from their initial position on the scene.
The center position will be decided according to the "initial direction" angle and the radius.
It can be used for:
- Making objects float, such as powerups or coins
- Moving platforms
- Enemy movement patterns
- Making a player constantly turn right or left ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://star-seeker))

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Sticker
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make objects follow the position and rotation of the object they are stuck to.
description: This extension can be useful to:
- Stick accessories to moving objects
- Animate a skeleton
- Delete an object with another one
An example allows to check it out ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://stick-objects)).

eventsFunctions.description: Define helper classes JavaScript code.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineHelperClasses

inlineCode: * Update the coordinates in the basisObject basis.
* It uses the basisObject coordinates from the previous frame.
* This way, the sticker can move relatively to it and still
// Save initial values to avoid calculus and rounding errors
* Copy the coordinates to use it the next frame.
* This method is also called by children to ensure
// If the behavior on the basis object has a different name,
// the objects will still follow their basis objects
// Follow parents 1st to avoid frame delays
// Unproportional dimensions changes won't work as expected
// if the object angle is not null but nothing more can be done
// because there is no full affine transformation on objects.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PopUp
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Display pop-ups to alert, ask confirmation, and let user type a response in text box.
description: This extension adds actions to display three kinds of pop-ups.
## Alert
- Pops-up a message that will pause the game until dismissed by the player.
## Confirmation
- Pops-up a dialogue containing a message with the option to either confirm or cancel.
## Prompt
**Note that this pop-up type is unsupported on previews and PC exports.**
- Displays a message to the player with a text field to write an answer in. The player will also have the option to either confirm or discard their input.
### Usage to save a value from a popup box:
![Screenshot of the way to use the extension to save a value in a variable](https://i.imgur.com/2iR5ofz.png)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: LinearMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects on a straight line.
description: Move objects on a straight line or according to their angle.

It can be used for simple enemies or bullets. It's usually not adapted for players (other behaviors are a better choice) or bullets fired with the actions provided by the "Fire Bullet" behavior (these bullets are already moved using a force).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RectangleMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects in a rectangular pattern.
description: Move objects in a rectangular pattern with easing functions from the Tween extension.
It can be used for:
- Moveable platforms
- Enemy movement patterns
- Moving along the border of another object (inside, center, outside)
The platformer example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer)).
This game shows how to make objects move around the border of another object ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://moving-saw-platformer)).
This example can be used to test different settings ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://rectangular-movement)).

events.comment: If point is inside rectangle, just use min distance

parameters:
min(
min(
MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterY() - CenterObject.BoundingBoxTop(), 
CenterObject.BoundingBoxBottom() - MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterY()),
min(
MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterX() - CenterObject.BoundingBoxLeft(), 
CenterObject.BoundingBoxRight() - MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterX())
)

events.comment: If point is outside rectangle, find distance to clamped position on rectangle

parameters:
DistanceBetweenPositions(
MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterX(),
MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterY(),
clamp(MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterX(), CenterObject.BoundingBoxLeft(), CenterObject.BoundingBoxRight()),
clamp(MovingObject.BoundingBoxCenterY(), CenterObject.BoundingBoxTop(), CenterObject.BoundingBoxBottom())
)
